newsitem.title: HUNGARY: HUNGARY RADIO NOON HEADLINES - OCT 1.
newsitem.headline: HUNGARY RADIO NOON HEADLINES - OCT 1.

text.p: These are the main headlines on Hungary's Kossuth Radio midday news. Reuters cannot vouch for their accuracy:
- Parliament is discussing last year's social security's closing figures.
- Student organisations gathering for a large demonstration this afernoon are having difficulty achieving unity.
- The government said its plan to allow people to opt out of the sick pay system referred to individual entrepreneurs and not employees.
- Prime Minister Gyula Horn told his usual monthly press conference that living standards are falling.
- From November 1 the State Treasury will take over state securities trading from the National Bank
